intro: Seidlitzia florida, commonly known as the Florida seidlitzia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils along the edges of swamps and wetlands. Seidlitzia florida is known for its adaptability to wetland environments and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and nectar for pollinators.
